title: Invention of the Radio Transmitter
description: Around 1900, Guglielmo Marconi successfully developed and demonstrated wireless radio communication, revolutionizing long-distance communication.

title: First Commercial Radio Broadcast
description: In 1910, the first commercial radio broadcast took place, marking the beginning of audio broadcasting to large audiences.

title: Birth of Modern Television
description: The 1920s saw early experiments with television technology, with John Logie Baird making progress in electronic video transmission.

title: Development of FM Radio
description: In 1933, Edwin Armstrong invented Frequency Modulation (FM) radio, improving sound quality and resistance to interference.

title: Early Electronic Computers
description: The 1940s saw the creation of early electronic digital computers like the ENIAC, laying the foundation for modern computing.

title: First Personal Computer
description: Introduced in 1977, the first personal computer made technology accessible and affordable for individuals.

title: Birth of the World Wide Web
description: Tim Berners-Lee proposed the World Wide Web in 1989, changing the way information is accessed and shared.

title: Introduction of the iPhone
description: Apple introduced the iPhone in 2007, redefining the smartphone industry.
